Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a means for the government to exert total control over people's lives and suppress free speech.
The bill is compared to tactics used by totalitarian states to control the masses.
There is a belief that the government is being deliberately dishonest and is hiding the legislation from the public.
The exemption of Federal and State governments from scrutiny under this legislation is seen as a breach of trust.
The submission expresses a loss of faith in parliamentarians and major media outlets for spreading misinformation.
The handling of the COVID-19 pandemic and the promotion of vaccines is cited as an example of government misinformation.
Notable Quotes: It is dangerous and beyond belief. It reminds me of how the totalitarian states of the past controlled the masses.
Why, at this time in history, should ‘the lucky country’ become ‘the country of misery’ because a government deems it cannot deal with apposing points of view or opinions.
In conclusion, this is a dangerous, unnecessary, and dystopian bill that may very well lead to disaster for our democratic society.
